description: From Yiddish לאַטקע‎ (latke), from either Russian ла́тка (látka, “pastry, patch”) or Ukrainian оладка (oladka, “pancake, fritter”). In Polish łatka (“patch”) or placek, placki (“fritter, fritters”).

entries.meaning: A pancake fried in oil, usually made from potatoes and sometimes also onions, traditionally served on Hanukkah.
examples: Her favorite Chanukah memories were of eating latkes and sour cream while her mother gossiped with the aunts and cousins.
